alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Perry (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 1:18PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PERRY AND NORTHWESTERN CUMBERLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 200 PM EDT... At 118 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Carlisle, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Carlisle, Plainfield, Schlusser, Newport, Duncannon, Newville, New Bloomfield, New Buffalo, Bloserville, Loysville, Ickesburg, Carlisle Springs, Colonel Denning State Park, Shermansdale, Millerstown and Landisburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for south central and central Pennsylvania.
